kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymssql.connect(database=AdventureWorks2012, user=NewLogin, password=1234567890, host=localhost, port=50768)

test.name: Table [Person].[Address]. Lengths of values of column rowguid is equal 36 for all records

kw.name: Row Count Is 0
kw.doc: Check if any rows are returned from the submitted `selectStatement`. If there are, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is 0 | SELECT * FROM [Person].[Address] WHERE LEN(rowguid) != 36;
Executing : Row Count | SELECT * FROM [Person].[Address] WHERE LEN(rowguid) != 36;

kw.name: Row Count Is 0

test.name: Table [Production].[UnitMeasure]. Verify maxmin values of UnitMeasureCode column

kw.name: Query
kw.arg: SELECT MAX(UnitMeasureCode) as max_value, MIN(UnitMeasureCode) as min_value FROM [Production].[UnitMeasure];
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | SELECT MAX(UnitMeasureCode) as max_value, MIN(UnitMeasureCode) as min_value FROM [Production].[UnitMeasure];

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
